snippet: Free-roaming dogs in India, many of which are rabid, number in the tens of millions and bite millions of people annually, including vast numbers of children.
abstract: New Delhi Journal; India has more stray dogs than any other country and no country suffers as much from them; free-roaming dogs number in the tens of millions and bite millions of people annually, including vast numbers of children; estimated 20,000 people die every year from rabies infections, more than a third of the global rabies toll.

byline.contributor: Malavika Vyawahare and Niharika Mandhana contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Free-roaming dogs in India, many of which are rabid, number in the tens of millions and bite millions of people annually, including vast numbers of children.

headline.seo: India Stray Dogs Are a Menace
headline.main: Where Streets Are Thronged With Strays Baring Fangs
headline.print_headline: Where Streets Are Thronged With Strays Baring Fangs
